items: Stand on a raised platform or step with the balls of your feet on the edge and your heels hanging off.
Hold onto a sturdy object for balance, such as a railing or wall.
Place a weight plate or dumbbell on top of your thighs, just above your knees.
Slowly lower your heels towards the ground, keeping your knees straight.
Pause at the bottom of the movement, then raise your heels as high as possible.
Hold the contraction at the top for a few seconds, then lower back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Targets the calf muscles, specifically the gastrocnemius and soleus
Helps to improve ankle stability and balance
Can be done with minimal equipment, making it a convenient exercise to do at home or at the gym
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to traditional calf raises
Can be easily modified by adjusting the weight or the position of the feet on the lever
